paper_abstract: The Laplacian Estrada index of a graph G is defined as LEE(G) = Sigma(n)(i=1)e(mu i), where mu(1), mu(2), . . ., mu(n) are the eigenvalues of the Laplacian matrix of G. In this paper, we characterize the trees with maximum Laplacian Estrada indices among trees with given matching number, dominating number, number of pendant vertices, and diameter, respectively.
paper_title: On Maximum Laplacian Estrada Indices of Trees with Some Given Parameters
